indicator_name1: 1.a.2: Proportion of total government spending on essential services (education, health and social protection) in total public spending

concepts:
State budget expenditures include all non-recoverable payments, whether they are reimbursable (i.e. paid in exchange for something) or not, and for what purpose - operational activities or acquisition of non-financial assets.
Expenditures are directed in the following dimensions: financing of State services related to economic activities (industry, agriculture, construction, communications, etc.); financing of social and cultural sphere (education, recreation, culture and religion, health, social protection, housing and communal services); public services, defence, public order and safety, environmental protection; acquisition of non-financial assets.
rationale_interpretation: Proportion of total government spending on essential services (education, health and social protection) in total public spending reveal degree of social orientation of public spending policy.
data_sources: Government expenditure data - administrative data of the Central Treasury of the Ministry of Finance of the Kyrgyz Republic (CT MoF KR) from reports on national, republican and local budget implementation.
data_collection: CT MoF KR submits reports on national, republican and local budget implementation on monthly and annual basis.
computation_methods: It is calculated as proportion of public spending on education (health, social protection) by functional classification of budget expenditure by type to total public spending (percentage).
data_availability_gaps: Indicator data have been annually available since 2007. The data are available on the NSC website under "Open Data" and "Statistics" / "Sustainable Development Goals". Data are also available on the MoF  KR website.
disaggregation: Indicator data are provided for the Kyrgyz Republic and three types of services.
international_comparability: Public spending in general and by type - according to the IMF Government Finance Statistics Manual 2001, including acquisition of non-financial assets.
